intro: Pentacalia chiribogae, commonly known as the Chiriboga pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, forested areas at moderate altitudes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
